title: Problem with datetime format
body:
## Problem statement

 I tried to send request to get server time, but i get zero time. I have similar code, that works with usual string, and this code works well, but with strfmt.datetime I have problem . As I can see, server send payload with right time, but client receive zero time. Can you help me to find problem? 
Or maybe you can give example, how to work with strfmt.datetime.

My code:
Server:
configure_api.go:
```
api.GetTimeHandler = operations.GetTimeHandlerFunc(func(params operations.GetTimeParams) middleware.Responder {
		t := models.Datetime(time.Now())
		fmt.Printf("Server time %v \n", time.Time(t).String())
		return operations.NewGetTimeOK().WithPayload(t)
	})
```
Client:
```
type Client struct {
	http *apiclient.ConfgenSwagger
}
func (c *Client) GetTime() (models.Datetime, error) {
	p := operations.NewGetTimeParams()
	resp, err := c.http.Operations.GetTime(p)
        if err != nil {
		fmt.Printf("Client time error  \n")
		return resp.Payload, err
	}
	t := resp.Payload
	fmt.Printf("Client time %v \n", time.Time(t).String())
	return t, err
}
```

I get next results:
```
Server time 2017-06-29 17:07:26.956884177 +0300 MSK
Client time 0001-01-01 00:00:00 +0000 UTC
```
## Swagger specification

```
...
datetime:
    type: string
    format: date-time
paths:
  /time:
    get:
      description: get server time
      operationId: getTime
      responses:
        '200':
          description: getTime success
          schema:
            $ref: "#/definitions/datetime"
        default:
          description : getTime error
          schema:
            $ref: "#/definitions/error"
```



## Environment
swagger version: 0.9.0  
go version: 1.5.3
